{{Wireless embedded system |brand=Zoom |model=4420 |revision= |upc= |ean= |asin= |price= |est_release_date= |fcc_date=03/30/2004 |manuf_country=Taiwan |manuf=Arcadyan |manuf_model=WA4001A |manuf_rev= |availability= |type=bridge |fcc_id=RAXWA4001AARC |ic_id= |pwr_v=5 |pwr_amp=1 |pwr_conn=barrel |pwr_barrel_inner= |pwr_barrel_outer= |pwr_barrel_len= |pwr_vac= |pwr_pol= |pwr_poe= |cpu1_brand=Intersil |cpu1_model=ISL3893 |cpu1_cspeed= |cpu2_brand= |cpu2_model= |cpu2_cspeed= |fla1=2 |fla1_brand=Macronix |fla1_model=MX29LV160BBTC-90 |fla1_num= |fla2= |fla2_brand= |fla2_model= |fla2_num= |ram1=8 |ram1_brand=ICSI |ram1_model=IC42S16400-TT |ram1_num= |ram2= |ram2_brand= |ram2_model= |ram2_num= |expansion_if_types= |expansion_pcmcia_num= |expansion_expresscard_num= |expansion_minipci_num= |expansion_minipcie_num= |expansion_usb_num= |jtag= |serial= |wi1_module= |wi1_module_if= |wi1_chip1_brand=Intersil |wi1_chip1_model=ISL3893 |wi1_chip2_brand=Intersil |wi1_chip2_model=ISL3686A |wi1_chip3_brand= |wi1_chip3_model= |wi1_802dot11_protocols=bg |wi1_ant_conn= |wi1_txchains= |wi1_rxchains= |wi1_sstreams= |wi2_module= |wi2_module_if= |wi2_chip1_brand= |wi2_chip1_model= |wi2_chip2_brand= |wi2_chip2_model= |wi2_chip3_brand= |wi2_chip3_model= |wi2_802dot11_protocols= |wi2_ant_conn= |wi2_txchains= |wi2_rxchains= |wi2_sstreams= |eth_none= |eth_cpu=true |eth_chip1_brand= |eth_chip1_model= |eth_chip2_brand=Altima |eth_chip2_model=AC101L |eth_chip3_brand= |eth_chip3_model= |sw_cpu= |sw_brand= |sw_model= |lan_speed=100M |lan_ports=1 |wan_ports= |flags= |tp_firmware= |802dot11_protocols=bg |default_ssid=ISL3893_11G,zoom |default_ssid_regex=^ISL3893_11G$,,,^zoom$ |default_ip=10.0.0.200 |default_user= |default_pass= |oui=00:12:BF |oui_eth=00:12:BF }} [http://www.zoomtel.com/techsupport/wireless_g/wireless4420.shtml Downloads]
OEM Arcadyan WA4001A
"P/N: 141400120000E REV: 01", "MADE IN CHINA" is silkscreened on the board. The included power supply is a '''DVE''' DSA-0151A-05 A (5V, 2.4A).
The device, upon booting, will probe for the network '''ISL3893_11G'''. By default, it will then probe for '''zoom'''. Any Ethernet device connected to the device while disconnected will cause the device to send probe requests with the Ethernet device's MAC address.
The ISL3893 WiSoC is not supported by any third-party Linux firmware. See http://isl3893.wikidot.com/ (alt. http://isl3893.sourceforge.net/ ) for information on the platform and a device list.
